body:
Nearly everything that is lacking from Cython boils down to closures (generators, lambda statements, nested function definitions). This ticket is simply to implement the most basic construct of nested functions.

There is a separate branch for this: http://hg.cython.org/cython-closures/

Migrated from http://trac.cython.org/ticket/82

comment_data.body:
@robertwb changed **description**

to

Nearly everything that is lacking from Cython boils down to closures (generators, lambda statements, nested function definitions). This ticket is simply to implement the most basic construct of nested functions.

There is a separate branch for this: http://hg.cython.org/cython-closures/
commented

**scoder** changed **owner** from `somebody` to `robertwb`
**status** from `reopened` to `new`
commented

Basically done now. A remaining issue is the module-level scope, which must support closures to handle generator expressions and lambda functions. See http://trac.cython.org/ticket/308.

@robertwb changed **resolution** from `fixed` to empty
**status** from `closed` to `reopened`
commented

Still needs testing and has a couple of bugs.

**scoder** changed **milestone** from `1.0` to `0.13`
**type** from `defect` to `enhancement`
commented

Targeting to 0.13 to make sure we do the merge before the release.

@robertwb commented

Well, we still need to merge the branches.

title: Implement closures
